they, I mentioned in the intro, sitting there with Spencer, both of you guys now drinking a whiskey.

So that was kind of my approach to the gospels and it's kind of been what I've been trying to get out of the gospels.

And he died under Pontius Pilate and there's nothing between those two things. It's as if he never lived. He just was born and he died.
And so figuring out what he was doing in between and why he was doing it and what he was trying to say.

I mean, we can all say it by heart and we all know it by by wrote, but it just kind of goes silent in your head when you say it that way.
You have to stop and look at every line.

Right. They just want to hear one man's opinion for an hour.

Wasn't necessarily God's mission. It wasn't necessarily going to make you feel more joyful.
But writing this book did.

I just knew I had to finish this book. That's a remarkable experience.

I've been doing the podcast has been a joy and it has been a shock as well because writers, as you may know, they live very solitary lives.

And so reason with ourselves, keep going.

That is so insightful. I'm disturbed and I'm also energized by the new thoughts.
